publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I Strole the City oft I
See a building large and lofty
not a bow shott from the Colledge
half the Globe from Sence & knowledge
by the prudent Architect
placed agṭ the Church direct
makeing good my Grandums Iest
near the Church you know ye rest
tell us what the pile Contains
many head that holds no brains
these Daemoniacks lett me dubb
with the Name of Legion Clubb.
Such Assemblies you might Swear
meet when butchers beat a Bear
Such a Noise & Such harrangueing
when a brother theif's a hanging
Such a rout and Such rabble
run to hear Jack Pudding gable
Such a Crowd their Ordure throws
on a Far-less Villians Nose
Could I from the buildings top
hear the rattleing thunder drop
while the Devill upon the rooffe
If the devill be thunder prooffe
Should with poker Fiery red
Crack the Stones and Melt yẹ ledd
drive them down on every Skull
while the Den of theiv overf's is Full
Quite destroy that Harpies Nest
how might then our Jsle be blest
for Divines allow that God
Sometimes Makes yẹ Devill his rod
and the Gospell will Informe us
he Can punish Sins Enormious
yet Should Swift endow the Schools
for his Lunaticks and Fools
with a rood or two of Land
I allow the pile may Stand
you perhaps may ask me why So
but it is with this proviso
Since the house is like to last
lett a Royal grant be past
that ye Club have right to dwell
each within his proper Cell
with a passage left to Creep in
and a hole above for peeping
Lett them when they once get in
Sell yẹ Nation for a Pin
while they Sitt a picking Straws
lett them rave of Makeing Laws
While they Never hold their tongue
lett them dable in their Dung
lett them Forme a Grand Comittee
how to plague & Starve the Citty
lett them Starve & Storme and Frown
when they See a Clergys Gown
Lett them e're they Crack a louse
Call for yẹ Orders of the house
Lett them with their Goslin Quills
Scrible Senceless heads of bills
we may while they Strain their throats
wipe our A────s with their Votes
Lett Sṛ T yṭ rampant ass
Stuffe his gutts with Flax & grass
but before the preist he Fleeces
tear ye bible all to peices
at ye Parsons Tom, holloo boy
worthy offspring of a Shoo-boy
Footman, traytor, Vile Seducer
perjured Rebell, brib'd Accuser
Lay thy paultry priviledge aside
Sprung from a papist & a regicide
Fall a working like a Mole
raise ye dirt about yoṛ hole
Come assist me Muse obedient
Let us try Some New Expedient
Shift the Scene for half an hour
time and place are in thy power
thither Gentle Muse Conduct me
I shall ask and you Jnstruct me
See the Muse Unbarrs the Gate
hark yẹ Monkey's how they prate
all ye Gods who rule the Soul
Styx thrô hell where waters roll
Let me be allowed to tell
what J heard in Yonder Cell
near the door an Entrance Gapes
Crowded round with Antick Shapes
Poverty and Greif and Care
Causeless Joy and true dispair
discord Periwigg'd with Snakes
See yẹ dreadfull Strides She takes
by this Odious Crew be·Sett
J began to rage and Frett
and resolved to break their pates
e're we Entered at yẹ Gates
had not Cloe in the Nick
whisper'd me lett down yoṛ Stick
what Said J is this the Mad house
these she Answered are but Shaddows
Fantoms bodyless and Vain
empty Visions of the brain
In the porch Briarius Stands
Shews a bride in all his hands
Briarius the Secretary
but we Mortalls Call him Carey.
when the Rogues their Country Fleece
they may Expect pence a peice
Clio overoe who had been So wise
to put on a Fools disguise
to be·speak Some approbation
and be thought a Near relacon
when She Saw two hundred brutes
all Jnvolved in Wild disputes
Roaring till their Lungs were Spent
Priviledge of Parliament
now a New Misfortune Feels
dreading to be laid by the heels
never durst a Muse before
enter that Jnfernall door
Clio Stiffled with the Smell
into Spleen and Vapours Fell
by the Stygean Streams that Flew
from the dire Jnfectious Crew
not yẹ Stench of Lake Avernus
Cou'd have more offended her Nose
had they Flown but o're the top
She must Feel her pinions drop
and by Exhalations dire
thô a Goddess must Expire
In ye Fright She Crept away
bravely J resolved to Stay
When J Saw the keeper Frown
tipping him wth half a Crown
Now Said J. we are alone
Name yoṛ Heroe's one by one
who is that hell Featured brawler
Is it Satan, no 'tis Waller
In what Figure Can a bard dress
Iack yẹ Grandson of Sṛ Hardress
honest keeper drive him further
In his looks are hell & Murder
See his Scolding Visage drop
Iust as when he Murdered Throp
Keeper Show me where to Fix
on the puppy pair of Dicks
by their Lanthorn Iaws & Leathern
you may Swear they both were brethern
Dick Fitzbaker Dick ye player
Old Acquaintance are you there
Dear Companions hugg & kiss
Toste old Glorious in yoṛ piss
tye them keeper in a tether
Lett them Starve & Stink together
both are apt to be Unruly
Lash them dayly lash them duely
thô its hopeless to reclaim them
Scorpion rods perhaps may tame them
Keeper yon Old Dotard Smoak
Sweetly Snoring in his Cloak
Who is he! 'tis humdrum Wynne
half Encompass'd by his Kin
there observe the tribe of Bingham
for he never Fails to bring them
and that base Apostate Vesey
with Bishops Scraps thô Fat & greasy
While he Sleeps the whole debate
they Submissive round him waite
Yet wḍ gladly See the huncks
in his grave & Search his truncks
See they gently twitch his Coat
Iust to yawn and give his Vote
allways Firm in his Vocacon
for the Court agṭ the Nation.
these are Allens Jack and Bob
First in every wicked overtt Jobb.
Son and brother to a Queer
brain·Sick brute they Call a Peer
we must give them better quarter
for their Ancestor trod Mortar
Who at Howth to boast his Fame
on a Chimney Cut his Name
there Sits Clements Dilks & Carter
who for hell would dye a Martyr
Such a triplett Could you tell
where to Find on this Side hell
Gallows Carter Dilks and Clements
Souse them in their Excrements
every Mischeif in their hearts
If they Fail 'tis want of parts
Bless us Morgan art thou there Man
Bless mine Eyes art thou yẹ Chairman
Chairman to yon damn'd Committee
yet I look on thee with pitty
Dreadfull Sight what learned Morgan
Metamorphos'd to a Gorgon
for thy horrid looks J own
half Convert me to a Stone
hast thou been So long at School
now to turne a Factious tool
Alma Mater was thy Mother
every Young divine thy brother
thou a disobedṭ Varlet
treat thy Mother like a Harlott
thou Ungreatfull to thy teachers
who are all grown Revḍ preachers
Morgan wḍ it not Surprise one
to turn thy Nourishment to poison
when you walk among yoṛ books
they reproach you with their looks
bind them Fast or from their Shelves
they'll Come down to right themselves
Homer Plutarch Virgill Flaccus
all in Arms prepare to back us
Soon repent or put to Slaughter
every Greek and Roman Author
Will you in yoṛ Factious Phrase
Send the Clergy all to graise
and to make yoṛ project pass
Leave them not a blade of grass
how J want the humorous Hogart
thou I hear a pleasant rogue art
were but you and I Acquainted
every Monster shḍ be painted
you shḍ trye yoṛ graveing tools
on this odious Groop of Foolls
draw the beasts as J describe them
Forme their Features as J give them
draw them like, for I assure you
you will want no Caractura
draw them So yṭ we may trace
all their Soull in every Face
Keeper I must now retire
you have done wṭ I desire
but I Feel my Spiritts Spent
with the Noise, the Sight the Scent
Pray be patient you Shall Find
half the best are Still behind
you have hardly Seen a Score
I Can Shew two hundred More
Keeper I have Seen enough
takeing then a pinch of Snuffe
I Concluded looking round them
May their God. the Devill Confound them
Except the righteous Fifty two
to whome Jmmortall honour's due829-005D
